Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: Illustrate and label two different habitats, one land-based and one water-based, with reasonable detail.
Depict and label a variety of living things in the land habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, or common animals like lizards and squirrels.
Depict and label a variety of living things in the water habitat, including fish and aquatic plants, with sufficient accuracy.
Show general differences between the two habitats by depicting a reasonable variety of living things in each.
Use their drawing to broadly explain patterns of plant and animal diversity in both habitats, although might lack some specific details.
CANNOT: Incorrectly label or confuse some living things between habitats (e.g., placing a terrestrial animal in the water habitat).
Lack some detail in regards to diversity explanations, possibly omitting specific species unique to each habitat.
Occasionally forget to label every depicted organism, leading to minor inconsistencies.
Show more subtle variations in ecosystems, such as special adaptations of certain species for each habitat.
